content.description:
Start as for Tender Tips, but continue up the right crack after the 2nd bolt. Takes small gear very well. Freshly cleaned May, 2019
Descent: You'll need a 70m or two ropes for the descent. Though you can kinda jump to the ground with a 60m...

Bolted anchor

Route begins left of Islands in the Sun and is a mix of corner and face climbing up past an old piton. Near the top is beautiful finger liebacking to reach the bolted anchors, the best part of the climb.

Second route in from the left, follows a dihedral up and slightly right. Crack begins slightly wide and then narrow near the top.
Gear to 2"

climbs.name: Fat Boy and the Buttless Wonder

content.description:
P1. 5.10b, 30m.Start just right of the dihedral. Friction moves up to a short crux just before the anchor.P2. 5.11a, 35m.Follow the thin crack above to a difficult stemming in the dihedral, then trend right on micro-edges to friction moves and finally chains. Bring 9 draws and two ropes. An excellent climb.

Second pitch is slightly runout. Bolted anchors with rings

A direct line up the left side of the slab. Face and friction moves just left of a corner lead to a groove with more friction above. Nice sustained technical climbing. Bolted.

Bolted anchor with rings

P1. 5.7, 30m.
Climb the big flakes rising along the white streak in the middle of the wall at the top of the trail. easy climbing to a ledge at the top of the flake then slightly more challenging(5.7) climbing up the dihedral to an easy finish. Trend RIGHT to a bolted belay station.
P2. 5.8, 35m.
Follow the long finger/hand crack above and RIGHT to a ledge and a station. With the exception of the last 5m, there is excellent protection up to 2”. You should be able to see the crack going all the way up to the top.
Descent: New stations allow for a rap with a 60m rope.

Left of the main hiking trail along the wall there is a white streak and a visible large flake. To the right of the bolted Island Hopping route
Gear to 2"

Same start as for Smiling Buddha then trend right through undercling and follow crack into tight dihedral. Climb small roof and short arete to anchors. Gear to 3.5 plus 7 bolts.
There is an intermediate rap station right of where the climbs diverge, required if using a 60m rope. 35m


Gear to 3.5'' and 7 bolts

Access: You can access from the trail leading to Jesus and Rendezvous, from the near the last switch back before Southern Dihederals, or go to the base of the Southern Dihederals and and hike climbers left along the base of the wall until you see the sign.
P1 - Sport 5.10b/c - Very comfortably bolted slabby arete. A mix of smears and small hands and feet will get you up.
P2 - Mixed 5.9 - From the belay follow the arching slab climbers left to right until you make a smeary traverse into the crack system. Follow the nice finger sized cracks to the bolted belay above.
P3 - Mixed 5.9- Continue falling the finger crack until you're forced to traverse right into the next section of crack. The crack runs out after a lovely fingers layback into a blocky section that finishes with a bit of slab
P4 - MIxed 5.10a - Left of the belay and up. Well protected crux on some balancy slab moves. Continue up a section of parallel cracks that offer good hands and good gear. Don't top out on the crack. Head right to the bolt on the face and up to a set of rings.
Descent: Rap rings. With a 70m rope you just rap the route. With a 60m rope you have to rap 5-7m from the 4th pitch anchors down and climbers right to another set of rings. Then continue down the rest of the route.

Bolted anchors. Single rack to 3''

Follow the crack just left of the arête, until the angle decreases, then trend left to a belay. The crux is short. The name refers to the big root which used to reside in the crack.

Bolted anchor with rings. Gear to 2'

Start in the right facing corner system, small pro for protection. Trend left into a tight dihedral with flaring finger tips - 10 bolts. 35m

Bolted anchor. Take small pros

Start at the right end of the slab, climb past a couple bolts to the thin crack. Bolted belay/rap anchor. 40m

Bolted belay/rap anchor.
Sunny varied climbing in some very cool dihedrals and slab climbs, all sizes of cracks available.
